## Import libraries

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(SignalingProfiler)
library(igraph)
```


## Step 1) Proteins' activity inference

```{r eval = FALSE}
phos_df <- read_tsv('../input/hela_phosphoproteomics.tsv') %>%
  distinct(UNIPROT, aminoacid, position, .keep_all = TRUE)

kin_phos_activity_foot <- run_footprint_based_analysis(omic_data = phos_df,
                                                       analysis = 'ksea',
                                                       organism = 'human',
                                                       reg_minsize = 5,
                                                       exp_sign = FALSE,
                                                       integrated_regulons = FALSE, # without the Atlas if FALSE
                                                       hypergeom_corr = TRUE,
                                                       GO_annotation = TRUE,
                                                       correct_proteomics = FALSE)

phosphoscore_df <- phosphoscore_computation(phosphoproteomic_data = phos_df,
                                            organism = 'human',
                                            activatory = TRUE ,
                                            GO_annotation = TRUE)

combined_kin_phos <- combine_footprint_and_phosphoscore(footprint_output = kin_phos_activity_foot,
                                                        phosphoscore_df =  phosphoscore_df,
                                                        analysis =  'ksea')
toy_tf <- phosphoscore_df %>%
  dplyr::filter(mf == 'tf') %>%
  dplyr::rename(final_score = phosphoscore) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(method = 'PhosphoScore')
toy_kin <- combined_kin_phos
toy_other <- phosphoscore_df %>%
  dplyr::filter(mf == 'other') %>%
  dplyr::rename(final_score = phosphoscore) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(method = 'PhosphoScore')

toy_activity_df <- dplyr::bind_rows(toy_tf, toy_kin, toy_other) %>%
  select(UNIPROT, gene_name, mf, final_score, method)

write_tsv(toy_activity_df, paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/protein_activities.tsv'))

```

```{r fig.width=12, fig.height=6, fig.align='center'}
inferred_proteins_df <- read_tsv('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/protein_activities.tsv')

inferred_proteins_df$mf <- factor(inferred_proteins_df$mf, levels = c('tf', 'kin', 'phos', 'other'))

ggplot(inferred_proteins_df,
       aes(x = fct_reorder(gene_name, final_score), y = final_score)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", aes(fill = final_score), alpha = 1) +
  facet_grid(. ~ mf, space ='free_x', scales = 'free') +
  theme_classic() +
  scale_fill_gradient2(low = "#89ABD6", high = "#FF6A72",
                       mid = "whitesmoke", midpoint = 0) +
  theme(text = element_text(size= 8),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 5),
        legend.position="bottom",
        legend.title = element_blank()) +
  xlab('') +
  #coord_flip()+
  ylab('Final score')

```


## Step 2) Causal network generation 

```{r eval = FALSE}

# Read inferred proteins
toy_prot_activity_df <- read_tsv(paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/protein_activities.tsv'))

# Naive network generation
PKN_table <- choose_PKN(organism = 'human',
                        with_atlas = FALSE,
                        custom = FALSE,
                        custom_path = NULL)

PKN_expressed <- preprocess_PKN(omics_data = list(phos_df),
                                PKN_table = PKN_table)

# divide proteins according to the molecular function
kin_phos_other <- toy_prot_activity_df %>%
  dplyr::filter(mf %in% c('kin', 'phos', 'other'))
tfs <- toy_prot_activity_df %>%
  dplyr::filter(mf == 'tf')

# create the na√Øve network
two_layers_toy <- two_layer_naive_network(starts_gn = c('EGFR'),
                                          intermediate_gn = kin_phos_other$gene_name,
                                          targets_gn = tfs$gene_name,
                                          PKN_table = PKN_expressed, #or PKN_mouse
                                          max_length_1 = 3,
                                          max_length_2 = 4,
                                          rds_path = paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/two_naive.rds'),
                                          sif_path = paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/two_naive.sif'),
                                          connect_all = TRUE)
# CARNIVAL RUN
receptor_list <- list('EGFR' = 1)

carnival_input <- prepare_carnival_input(two_layers_toy,
                                         toy_prot_activity_df,
                                         receptor_list,
                                         organism = 'human')

solver = 'cplex'
carnival_options = default_CARNIVAL_options(solver)

# Two layered CARNIVAL

# FIRST RUN: RECEPTOR to KIN, PHOS, OTHERS
receptors_df <- carnival_input %>%
  dplyr::filter(mf == 'rec')

target1_df <- carnival_input%>%
  dplyr::filter(mf %in% c('kin', 'phos', 'other') & gene_name != 'EGFR')

naive_network <- readr::read_tsv(paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/two_naive.sif'),
                                 col_names = c('source', 'interaction', 'target'))

carnival_input %>% filter(!(gene_name == 'EGFR' & mf == 'kin')) -> carnival_input
output1 <- run_carnival_and_create_graph(source_df = receptors_df,
                                         target_df = target1_df,
                                         naive_network = unique(naive_network),
                                         proteins_df = carnival_input,
                                         organism = 'human',
                                         carnival_options = carnival_options,
                                         files = FALSE,
                                         with_atlas = FALSE)

# SECOND RUN: from KIN, PHOS, OTHERS to TFs
run1_output_nodes <- convert_output_nodes_in_next_input(output1)

run1_output_nodes2 <- molecular_function_annotation(inferred_proteins_dataset = run1_output_nodes,
                                                    organism = 'human')

source_df <- run1_output_nodes %>%
  dplyr::filter(mf %in% c('kin', 'phos', 'other'))
source_df$UNIPROT <- ''

target2_df <- carnival_input %>%
  dplyr::filter(mf == 'tf')

output2 <- run_carnival_and_create_graph(source_df = source_df,
                                         target_df = target2_df,
                                         naive_network = unique(naive_network),
                                         proteins_df = carnival_input,
                                         organism = 'human',
                                         carnival_options = carnival_options,
                                         files = FALSE,
                                         with_atlas = FALSE)

# UNION OF RUN1 and RUN2 graphs
union <- union_of_graphs(graph_1 = output1$igraph_network,
                         graph_2 = output2$igraph_network,
                         proteins_df = carnival_input,
                         files = TRUE,
                         path_sif = paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/union_optimized.sif'),
                         path_rds = paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/union_optimized.rds'))

# EXPANSION and MAPPING of PHOSPHOPROTEOMICS DATA ON EDGES
union_graph_rds <- readRDS(paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/union_optimized.rds'))
union_graph_sif <- readr::read_tsv(paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/union_optimized.sif'),
                                   col_names = c('source', 'interaction', 'target'))

union_output_final <- expand_and_map_edges(optimized_object = union_graph_rds,
                                           organism = 'human',
                                           phospho_df = phos_df,
                                           files = TRUE,
                                           with_atlas = FALSE,
                                           path_sif = paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/union_validated.sif'),
                                           path_rds = paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/union_validated.rds'))

# Format analysis for visualization
final_sp_visualization <- format_for_visualization(union_output_final)

# Visualization in Cytoscape
# RCy3::createNetworkFromIgraph(igraph=final_sp_visualization$igraph_network,
#                               title = paste0('NO PHENOTYPES NEW'),
#                               collection = 'Hela EGF')


```

## Step 3) Hallmark phenotypes inference

```{r eval = FALSE}

# PhenoScore computation new
pheno_table_distances <- phenoscore_network_preprocessing(proteomics = phos_df %>% mutate(gene_name = str_to_upper(gene_name)),
                                                          phospho = phos_df %>% mutate(gene_name = str_to_upper(gene_name)))

sp_output <- readRDS(paste0('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/union_validated.rds'))

# tibble(phenotypes = unique(pheno_table_distances$EndNode)) -> phenotype_df
# write_tsv(phenotype_df, './phenotypes.tsv')

phenotype_df <- read_tsv( '../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/phenotypes.tsv') %>% filter(select == 'x')

toy_phenoscore_output<- phenoscore_computation(proteins_df = sp_output$nodes_df,
                                               desired_phenotypes = phenotype_df$phenotypes,
                                               pheno_distances_table = pheno_table_distances,
                                               sp_graph = sp_output$igraph_network,
                                               # closeness of proteins to phenotypes
                                               path_length = 4,
                                               stat = 'mean',
                                               zscore_threshold = -1.96,
                                               # exclude random phenotypes
                                               n_random = 1000,
                                               pvalue_threshold = 0.05,
                                               # optimized network  specificity
                                               remove_cascade = TRUE,
                                               node_idx = TRUE,
                                               use_carnival_activity = TRUE,
                                               create_pheno_network = TRUE)

toy_phenoscore_output$table_phenotypes -> table_pheno

write_rds(toy_phenoscore_output, 
          '../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/EGF_new_phenotypes.RDS')
```

## Step 4) Generate functional circuits for higher interpretability 

#### Step 4a) Optimization of the final network over phenotypic activity 

```{r eval = FALSE}

output_list <- read_rds('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela//EGF_new_phenotypes.RDS')
background_phos <- read_tsv('../input/hela_phosphoproteomics.tsv')

solver = 'cplex'
carnival_options <- default_CARNIVAL_options(solver)

opt1 <- optimize_pheno_network(sp_object = output_list,
                               organism = 'human',
                               phospho_df = background_phos,
                               carnival_options = carnival_options,
                               files = TRUE,
                               direct = TRUE,
                               with_atlas = FALSE,
                               path_sif = '../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/pheno_opt1.sif',
                               path_rds = '../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/pheno_opt1.rds')

# Visualization in Cytoscape
RCy3::createNetworkFromIgraph(igraph=opt1$sp_object_phenotypes$igraph_network,
                              title = 'Optimized model',
                              collection = 'Hela EGF')
data_path <- system.file("extdata", "SP_pheno_layout.xml", package = "SignalingProfiler")
RCy3::importVisualStyles(filename = data_path)
RCy3::setVisualStyle('SP_pheno_layout')

```

#### Step 4b) Functional circuits visualization

```{r eval = FALSE}

opt1 <- readRDS('../results/6.independent_datasets/hela/pheno_opt1.rds')

opt1$sp_object_phenotypes <- format_for_visualization(opt1)

# Circuits on ribosome_biogenesis, autophagy and translational_elongation
phenotypes <- c('RIBOSOME_BIOGENESIS', 'AUTOPHAGY', 'TRANSLATIONAL_ELONGATION')
start_nodes <- c('EGFR')

# Circuit on autophagy, ribosome and translation
circuit <- pheno_to_start_circuit(SP_object = opt1,
                                  start_nodes = start_nodes,
                                  phenotypes = phenotypes,
                                  k = 5,
                                  start_to_top = TRUE)

RCy3::createNetworkFromIgraph(igraph=circuit,
                              title = 'AUTOPHAGY,RIBOSOME',
                              collection = 'Hela EGF')
RCy3::setVisualStyle('SP_pheno_layout')

# Circuit cell cycle
circuit <- pheno_to_start_circuit(SP_object = opt1,
                                  start_nodes = start_nodes,
                                  phenotypes = c('CELL_CYCLE_BLOCK', 'PROLIFERATION',
                                                 'CELL_CYCLE_PROGRESS_',
                                                 'CELL_GROWTH', 'G1_S_TRANSITION'),
                                  k = 5,
                                  start_to_top = TRUE)

RCy3::createNetworkFromIgraph(igraph=circuit,
                              title = 'CELL CYCLE NEW',
                              collection = 'Hela EGF')
RCy3::setVisualStyle('SP_pheno_layout')


```
